com.github.nfcforandroid.writers

Class AbstractWriter<Record extends INfaRecord>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.nfcforandroid.writers.AbstractWriter<Record>
  • Type Parameters:
    Record -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    INfaWriter<Record>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractNdefWriter, EmptyWriter

    public abstract class AbstractWriter<Record extends INfaRecord>
extends java.lang.Object
implements INfaWriter<Record>
    Author:
    jefBinomed Abstract class that define the standard method for the management of init(INfaRecord), isInit() and reset() An empty byte is integrated in this class for the management of empty datas

      • init

        public void init(Record record)
        Description copied from interface: INfaWriter
        Set the inner record with value in parameters
        Specified by:
        init in interface INfaWriter<Record extends INfaRecord>

      • isInit

        public boolean isInit()
        Specified by:
        isInit in interface INfaWriter<Record extends INfaRecord>
        Returns:
        true if the data is in init state. This is use by the library to guaranty the non recalculation of INfaWriter.getLength(). The best practice is to check if the inner record is null or not

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: INfaWriter
        reset the state of INfaWriter.isInit() to have a result that produce false. You could set the inner record to null
        Specified by:
        reset in interface INfaWriter<Record extends INfaRecord>
